VRICH IVY Leaf Syrup Find Relief in IVY leaf VRICH is a natural formulation containing Ivy leaf extract.

VRICH acts as an expectorant and relieves congestion.

VRICH has anti-inflammatory effect that soothes bronchial mucus membrane and reduces irritation.

VRICH is devoid of harmful side effects which are associated with OTC cough suppressants.

VRICH is non-drowsy and alcohol free formulation.

VRICH is a sugar free syrup that is suitable for diabetic individuals.

Dosage: Children (1-6 years) 2.5ml, 3 times a day.

Children (Above 6 years & upto 12 years) 5ml, 3 times a day.

Children & Adults (Above 12 years & Adults) 5-7.5ml, 3 times a day.

Manufactured by: Richmond Pharmaceuticals Limited, Plot No.

P-14, Phase I-A, M3 Industrial Estate (FIEDMC), Faisalabad, Pakistan.

Non-Sedating Free from Alcohol Richmond IVY Leaf Cough Syrup 120 ml

VRICH PLUS SYRUP COUGH LESS BREATH MORE VRICH PLUS provides triple therapy of Thyme, Licorice, and Vascia extracts along with the Ivy leaf extract.

VRICH PLUS effectively relieves productive and non-productive cough.

VRICH PLUS provides an add-on advantage by relieving fever, sore throat, wheezing, and brochospasms. VRICH PLUS is devoid of harmful side effects which are associated with OTC cough suppressants.

VRICH PLUS is a non-drowsy and alcohol free formulation.

VRICH PLUS is a sugar free syrup that is suitable for diabetic individuals.

Dosage: Children (1-6 years) 2.5ml, 2 times a day.

Children (Above 6 years & upto 12 years) 5ml, 2 times a day.

Children & Adults (Above 12 years & Adults) 5ml, 3 times a day.

Manufactured by Richmond Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd, Plot No.

P-14, Phase I-A, M3 Industrial Estate (FIEDMC), Faisalabad, Pakistan.

Non-Sedating Free from Alcohol Richmond Pharmaceuticals Pvt Ltd 120ml

 FRONT The DEFENCE, The DELIGHT Double

CRANRICH contains the goodness of Natural Cranberry Extract and Vitamin C.

CRANRICH minimizes the incidence of Urinary Tract Infection (UTI).

CRANRICH provides antioxidant support and strengthens the Immune system.

CRANRICH reduces the Urinary Tract inflammation thereby improving urinary incontinence and recurrent urination.

CRANRICH is palatable and easy to use natural formula.

Dosage and Directions for use: For oral use only.

Dissolve the content of one sachet in a glass of water and use immediately.

Use one sachet daily or as directed by the physician.

CRANRICH contains Natural Cranberry Extract.

CRANRICH reduces the incidence of recurrent Urinary Tract Infections (UTIs).

CRANRICH reduces the inflammation of Urinary Tract associated with UTIs.

CRANRICH sufficiently improves recurrent urination and Urinary incontinence associated with UTIs.

CRANRICH has pleasant taste.

Dosage and Directions for use: For oral use only.

Dissolve the content of one sachet in a glass of water and use immediately.

chunks.parent_text:
Detoxification and improvement of metabolic functions in hepatobiliary disorders.

COMPOSITION: Each capsule contains: Artemisia absinthium Extract (USP) 15mg, Swertia chirayita Extract (MS) 20mg, Baptisia australis Extract (MS) 10mg, Common fumitory Extract (MS) 25mg.

DOSAGE: For oral use only.

Adults: Take 1 capsule twice a day or as directed by the physician.

PRECAUTIONS: In case of hypersensitivity reaction, consult a physician.

Use with caution in individuals with a history of gastrointestinal ulcers or inflammatory bowel diseases.

Should be used under medical supervision in patients with severe liver disease.

Avoid concurrent use with hepatotoxic drugs or alcohol.

Monitor liver function parameters during prolonged use.

SIDE EFFECTS: This formulation is generally considered safe.

In rare cases mild gastrointestinal discomfort such as nausea, abdominal discomfort and diarrhea are reported.

In such case please consult a physician.

CONTRAINDICATION: Hypersensitivity to any ingredient contained in the formulation.

Patients with Obstructive biliary disorders or gallstones are advised not to use this formulation unless advised by the physician.

PREGNANCY AND LACTATION: Consult your physician before taking this product.

OVERDOSAGE: Do not exceed the recommended dosage.

PRESENTATION: ABSINTH CAPSULE: 42 Capsules.

INSTRUCTIONS: Store below 30¬∞C.

Protect from heat, direct sunlight, and moisture.

Keep all medicines out of reach of children.

SUPPLEMENT FOR GOOD HEALTH Please consult with a healthcare professional before initiating any new dietary supplement regimen, especially if you have any underlying health condition, are pregnant or taking any medications.

Manufactured by: Richmond Pharmaceuticals Limited, Plot No.

P-14, Phase I-A, M3 Industrial Estate (FIEDMC), Faisalabad, Pakistan.

RM's GUF COUGH SYRUP Non-Sedating and Free from Alcohol Alternative Medicine - Nutraceutical DESCRIPTION RM's Guf Cough Syrup is a unique polyherbal extracts formulation designed to provide effective symptomatic relief from both dry and productive cough.

It soothes the throat and reduces irritation and effectively treats the cough associated with conditions such as bronchitis, pharyngitis, cold, flu, and sore throat.

RM's Guf Cough Syrup works by promoting easy expectoration, easing congestion, and calming inflammation, providing quick relief without harsh side effects.

Suitable for both adults and children, it provides natural support for respiratory comfort and well-being.

PHARMACOLOGICAL PROPERTIES OF ACTIVE INGREDIENTS: Lavandula stoechas Ext.: It exhibits bronchodilator activity, that relaxes smooth muscles in the airways, relieves the symptoms of respiratory conditions like asthma and bronchitis thus beneficial for easing breathing difficulties and promoting respiratory comfort.

Malva sylvestris Ext.: It has demulcent properties that soothe the throat, provides relief from throat irritation and reduces coughing.

Its anti-inflammatory and mucilage content help alleviate dry and productive coughs, promoting easier breathing.

Althaea officinalis Ext.: It contains mucilage which forms a protective coating on the throat, soothing irritation and reducing coughing.

Its demulcent and anti-inflammatory properties help relieve both dry and productive coughs.

Glycyrrhiza glabra Ext.: It has demulcent and expectorant properties, which soothe the throat and enable the expulsion of mucus.

Its anti-inflammatory effects provide relief from coughs and respiratory conditions like bronchitis.

Zizipus jujuba Ext.: It has soothing and anti-inflammatory properties that help relieve irritation in the respiratory tract.

It is beneficial for treating coughs, bronchitis, and respiratory congestion by promoting easier breathing and reducing inflammation.

Cassia fistula Ext.: It has expectorant properties which help clear mucus from the respiratory tract, easing the symptoms of cough and bronchitis.

Its anti-inflammatory and soothing effects provide relief from respiratory irritation and congestion.

Viola odorata Ext.: It has soothing and anti-inflammatory properties that help alleviate throat irritation and reduce coughing.

It acts as a mild expectorant, promoting the clearing of mucus from the respiratory tract, making breathing easier.

Terminalia chebula Ext.: It has anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties that help reduce respiratory tract inflammation and fight infections.

It also acts as an expectorant, promoting the clearing of mucus and easing symptoms of cough and bronchitis.

COMPOSITION: Each 5ml contains: Lavandula stoechas Ext.

(MS) 0.2ml, Malva sylvestris Ext.

(MS) 0.1ml, Althaea officinalis Ext.

GARLK CAPSULES Pure Garlic Extract Reduces Total Level Of Cholesterol Antioxidant Provides Immune And Cardiac Support DESCRIPTION: GARLK Capsules contain standardized Garlic Extract (Allium sativum) used to support cardiovascular health, immune function and antioxidant defense.

Garlic extract is a concentrated form of garlic, rich in sulfur compounds (like allicin, diallyl disulfides) and antioxidants, used for health benefits like immune support, heart health (cholesterol/blood pressure), and anti-inflammatory/antimicrobial effects, presented as a spray dried standardised powder extract with a naturally strong, characteristic fragrance.

Each capsule contains: Garlic Extract (USP) 300mg


INDICATIONS / BENEFITS: Supports cardiovascular health, Helps reduce cholesterol, Immune system support, Antioxidant protection.

DOSAGE & ADMINISTRATION: Adults: Take 2 capsules once daily before meal or as directed by physician.

PRECAUTIONS: Do not exceed recommended dose.

Consult physician if on blood thinners.

SIDE EFFECTS: Rarely mild gastric discomfort.

CONTRAINDICATIONS: Hypersensitivity to garlic.

Not recommended under 18 years.

Pregnancy & Lactation: Consult physician before use.

STORAGE: Store below 30¬∞C, protect from heat and moisture.

SUPPLEMENT FOR GOOD HEALTH Manufactured by: Richmond Pharmaceuticals Natural Division, Plot No.

P-14, Phase I-A, M3 Industrial Estate (FIEDMC), Faisalabad, Pakistan.

Chemical Constituents: Allin, Allicin, Diallyl trisulfide (DATS), Diallyl disulfide (DADS), Diallyl sulfide (DAS), Allyl mercaptan, E-Ajoene, Z-Ajoene, Cysteine sulfoxide, S-allyl cysteine sulfoxide, Allyl methyl sulfide (AMS), Thiacremonone, 1.2 Vinylidithin, Gamma-glutamylCysteine

Here‚Äôs a comprehensive, medically referenced summary of Vitamin E 400 IU (International Units) sachet/capsule ‚Äî commonly an alpha‚Äëtocopherol supplement used to prevent or treat vitamin E deficiency and as an antioxidant support. Information below is drawn from pharmacology references and professional drug monographs.

üß¨ 1.

What It Is
Vitamin E is a fat‚Äësoluble vitamin (most commonly as alpha‚Äëtocopherol).

It functions physiologically as an antioxidant and is essential for normal cellular function.

Oral 400‚ÄØIU supplements are a common therapeutic form.

‚öôÔ∏è 2.

Mechanism of Action
Antioxidant activity: Vitamin E neutralizes free radicals and prevents propagation of oxidative damage in cell membranes, particularly protecting polyunsaturated fatty acids in membranes.

Membrane stability: Helps stabilize cell membranes and prevent lipid peroxidation.

Effects on clotting: In higher doses, it inhibits platelet aggregation and can interfere with vitamin K‚Äëdependent coagulation pathways.

Immune modulation: May enhance some immune responses, especially in older adults, though clinical benefit varies by condition.

üíä 3.

Benefits / Uses
Vitamin E 400‚ÄØIU may be used for:

‚úî Primary Uses
Vitamin E deficiency: Particularly in fat‚Äëmalabsorption syndromes (e.g., cystic fibrosis, cholestatic liver disease).

General antioxidant support: Helps reduce oxidative stress.

‚úî Optional/Adjunctive Uses (clinician‚Äëguided)
Evidence for some uses is limited or mixed ‚Äî discuss with your clinician.

Support in some peripheral neuropathies linked to deficiency.

Adjunctive antioxidant support in certain chronic conditions (e.g., atherosclerosis theory, not universally recommended).

Supportive therapy in hemolytic anemia due to deficiency.

‚ö† Note: Routine ‚Äúhealth boosting‚Äù or high‚Äëdose use without documented deficiency is generally not recommended due to limited evidence and potential risks at higher doses.

‚öñÔ∏è 4.

Dosage
(Typical supplemental doses; tailored by clinician to individual needs)

üíä Adults
Standard supplementary dose: ~400‚ÄØIU once daily.

Deficiency or special conditions: Clinician may adjust upward (e.g., 600‚Äì800‚ÄØIU), but should be monitored.

üßí Children
Dose depends on age/weight and reason ‚Äî often much lower per pediatric guidance.

üìå Important: The recommended daily allowance (RDA) for most adults from food is ~15‚ÄØmg (~22.5‚ÄØIU); 400‚ÄØIU is a supplemental therapeutic dose, not a dietary requirement.

‚ö†Ô∏è 5.

Precautions
Bleeding risk: Higher doses can increase bleeding risk, especially with anticoagulants/antiplatelet drugs or in vitamin K deficiency.

Surgery: High‚Äëdose vitamin E should be stopped 1‚Äì4 weeks before surgery due to clotting risk.

Pregnancy/Lactation: Use only under clinician guidance ‚Äî routine high‚Äëdose supplementation is not universally recommended.

Chronic disease: Those with liver/kidney disease or malabsorption disorders require adjusted or supervised dosing.

Long‚Äëterm high doses: Some studies report potential increases in all‚Äëcause mortality with long‚Äëterm use ‚â•400‚ÄØIU/day ‚Äî balance risks and benefits.

üîÑ 6.

Drug Interactions
Vitamin E may interact with:

‚ö† Important Interactions
Warfarin & antiplatelets (e.g., aspirin, clopidogrel): Increased bleeding risk due to additive effects.

Statins/Niacin: Theoretical antioxidant interference with lipid‚Äëmodifying benefits.

Chemotherapy & radiation: Antioxidants may reduce therapeutic oxidative damage to tumor cells ‚Äî consult oncologist.

Orlistat / cholestyramine / mineral oil: Fat‚Äësoluble vitamin absorption may be reduced.

Other Potential
Iron therapy: High doses may delay iron therapy response in children.

üß™ 7.

Side Effects
At normal doses (e.g., 400‚ÄØIU/day), side effects are uncommon, but may include: 

Common/Milder
GI upset (nausea, diarrhea)

Fatigue

Headache

Blurred vision or dizziness (rare)

Less Common/Serious (higher doses or long‚Äëterm)
Increased risk of bleeding or hemorrhagic stroke

Altered clotting parameters

Possible increased all‚Äëcause mortality at very high doses

Allergic reactions (rare)

üìö 8.

Reference Textbooks / Guidelines
Reputable standard references that include in‚Äëdepth pharmacology and clinical details on vitamin E include:

Goodman & Gilman‚Äôs The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics ‚Äì Antioxidants and fat‚Äësoluble vitamins section.

Katzung & Trevor‚Äôs Basic & Clinical Pharmacology ‚Äì Vitamin/antioxidant drug mechanisms and interactions.

Medscape / Drugs.com Monographs ‚Äì Clinical dosing, interactions, and adverse effects.

Mayo Clinic / WebMD Drug & Supplement Databases ‚Äì Patient‚Äëoriented dosing and warnings.
